pull.title: ci: Run base install at most once
pull.body:
This should avoid errors when running it twice. For example, network errors on the second invocation of 'apt update'; or unguarded modifications such as APPEND_APT_SOURCES_LIST, which will append the same string repeatedly.

The base install may be run twice in Cirrus CI with dockerfiles, or locally when running twice with DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST specified.

events.body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--021abf342d371248e50ceaed478a90ca-->
### Reviews
See [the guideline](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#code-review) for information on the review process.
| Type | Reviewers |
| ---- | --------- |
| ACK | [josibake](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27429#pullrequestreview-1374461290) |

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.

For testing:

```
# (Obviously only run this in a throw-away VM) # DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST="1" MAKEJOBS="-j1" FILE_ENV="./ci/test/00_setup_env_native_nowallet_libbitcoinkernel.sh" ./ci/test_run_all.sh
```

verification.payload:
tree f93ce151584d6d813d273360906484aebb8de192
parent 5a8bd4505687a7ec76d731b1a8249ee04d641990
author MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1680250815 +0200
committer MarcoFalke <*~=`'#}+{/-|&$^_@721217.xyz> 1680774750 +0200

ci: Run base install at most once

This should avoid errors when running it twice. For example, network
errors on the second invocation of 'apt update'; or unguarded
modifications such as APPEND_APT_SOURCES_LIST, which will append the
same string repeatedly.

The base install may be run twice in Cirrus CI with dockerfiles, or
locally when running twice with DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST specified.

events.message:
ci: Run base install at most once

This should avoid errors when running it twice. For example, network
errors on the second invocation of 'apt update'; or unguarded
modifications such as APPEND_APT_SOURCES_LIST, which will append the
same string repeatedly.

The base install may be run twice in Cirrus CI with dockerfiles, or
locally when running twice with DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST specified.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,21 +55,22 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
                   $CONTAINER_NAME)
   export CI_CONTAINER_ID
   export CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX="docker exec ${CI_CONTAINER_ID}"
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}"
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ro_base/ "$BASE_ROOT_DIR"
-  # Fixes permission issues when there is a container UID/GID mismatch with the owner
-  # of the mounted bitcoin src dir.
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX git config --global --add safe.directory "*"
 else
   echo "Running on host system without docker wrapper"
-  "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
 fi
 
 CI_EXEC () {
   $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX bash -c "export PATH=${BINS_SCRATCH_DIR}:\$PATH && cd \"$P_CI_DIR\" && $*"
 }
 export -f CI_EXEC
 
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "CI base install missing"
+CI_EXEC "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ro_base/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "Nothing to copy from ro_base"
+# Fixes permission issues when there is a container UID/GID mismatch with the owner
+# of the git source code directory.
+CI_EXEC git config --global --add safe.directory '*'
comments.body: I think double quotes is the safest, although I can't remember where I saw that..

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -55,21 +55,22 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
                   $CONTAINER_NAME)
   export CI_CONTAINER_ID
   export CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX="docker exec ${CI_CONTAINER_ID}"
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}"
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ro_base/ "$BASE_ROOT_DIR"
-  # Fixes permission issues when there is a container UID/GID mismatch with the owner
-  # of the mounted bitcoin src dir.
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX git config --global --add safe.directory "*"
 else
   echo "Running on host system without docker wrapper"
-  "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
 fi
 
 CI_EXEC () {
   $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX bash -c "export PATH=${BINS_SCRATCH_DIR}:\$PATH && cd \"$P_CI_DIR\" && $*"
 }
 export -f CI_EXEC
 
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "/ci_base_install/ missing"
+CI_EXEC "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ro_base/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "Nothing to copy from ro_base"
+# Fixes permission issues when there is a container UID/GID mismatch with the owner
+# of the git source code directory.
+CI_EXEC git config --global --add safe.directory \"*\"
comments.body: if you run this without docker, won't this change the user's local git config? probably fine since you should be running with docker if running locally, but might be worth mentioning in the comment

@@ -55,21 +55,22 @@ if [ -z "$DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST" ]; then
                   $CONTAINER_NAME)
   export CI_CONTAINER_ID
   export CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX="docker exec ${CI_CONTAINER_ID}"
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}"

-  # of the mounted bitcoin src dir.
-  $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX git config --global --add safe.directory "*"
 else
   echo "Running on host system without docker wrapper"
-  "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
 fi
 
 CI_EXEC () {
   $CI_EXEC_CMD_PREFIX bash -c "export PATH=${BINS_SCRATCH_DIR}:\$PATH && cd \"$P_CI_DIR\" && $*"
 }
 export -f CI_EXEC
 
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ci_base_install/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "/ci_base_install/ missing"
+CI_EXEC "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}/ci/test/01_base_install.sh"
+CI_EXEC rsync --archive --stats --human-readable /ro_base/ "${BASE_ROOT_DIR}" || echo "Nothing to copy from ro_base"
+# Fixes permission issues when there is a container UID/GID mismatch with the owner
+# of the git source code directory.
+CI_EXEC git config --global --add safe.directory \"*\"
comments.body: Yes, `DANGER_RUN_CI_ON_HOST` is called that way to discourage people from trashing their system

comments.body: (This applies to all `CI_EXEC` lines, so I don't think anything is gained from mentioning it here)
